Award.AwardTitle: REU Site: Application of Microscopy and Microanalysis in Multidisciplinary Research
Award.AbstractNarration:
NON-TECHNICAL DESCRIPTION: Portland State University (PSU) continues its operation of a multidiscipline research experience for undergraduate site, the only site of its kind in the greater Portland region. This site has been successfully operating for the past fifteen years and has achieved a high level of participation from women and minorities. The objective of the REU site will continue to focus on inspiring undergraduate students with an emphasis on women, minorities, and US Armed Forces veterans to pursue careers in science and engineering by exposing them to hands-on research opportunities. In addition, the new recruitment will include participants who show great interest in research, but are underachieving academically. It is highly expected that this REU site will enable such students to develop their talents and progress towards their career goals.

TECHNICAL DESCRIPTION: The REU site at PSU ties diverse research projects together under the overarching theme of electron microscopy for multidisciplinary applications. Through a concentrated summer program, the participants will obtain technical training, conduct independent research, visit local high-tech industries, and present their research at an REU symposium. The activities will begin with a training week including workshops on laboratory safety, library database searches, and graduate school applications. Also offered is an intensive short course that trains students in using scanning electron microscope or focused ion beam microscope for material and device characterization. Students will then use these acquired skills in research projects offered by faculty mentors from the departments of Mechanical and Materials Engineering, Electrical and Computer Engineering, Physics, Chemistry, Biology, and Geology. It is highly anticipated that REU participants will leave the summer program with a quintessential skill (electron and ion microscopy) applicable to all disciplines and a broader perspective of the impact of research experience on their high education and career choices.

POR.DRECONTENT:
During the three-year grant funding period, our REU program focused on multi-disciplinary collaboration, encouraging students from a variety of backgrounds and with numerous scientific interests to apply for the program. As a result, the REU site coordinates with faculty members from a number of different departments including Physics, Chemistry, Biology, Geology, Mechanical & Materials Engineering, Civil Engineering, and Electrical and Computer Engineering, at Portland State University (PSU) in order to provide a wide range of research opportunities for undergraduate research students representing minority, veteran, and female populations. 

 

This REU program employs a dynamic interactive method that leverages existing education and research infrastructures and technology at PSU to provide comprehensive training, practicing, and supervising for REU participants, allowing them to gain multidisciplinary experiences applicable in multiple scientific fields. The outcomes and accomplishments are multifold, representing a wide range of skill sets and achievements that are a result of the multifaceted approach to interdisciplinary research. This program also employs ?cascade training methodology,? where REU participants are guided by expert PSU Faculty Research Mentors while graduate students serve as REU participants? lab supervisors or partners to conduct research projects. The knowledge they gained during this research program is presented in their research papers and a technical presentation at the REU Summer Research Symposium, which is the concluding event of the eight-week summer research program. 

 

Before the REU participants joining the research faculty?s group starting at the second week, all the REU participants go through the training week activities. The meticulously planned schedule for the training week? which includes basic lab research skills and a short course on using electron microscopy for multidisciplinary research?has proven to be very effective. Subsequently, weekly group meetings for career enrichment, and educational field trips provide REU participants with ample knowledge to succeed in their chosen career paths. Building on the research experiences and other skills they gained as part of the REU program, the participants step into the field of STEM education with renewed imagination and zeal to reach new pinnacles. 

 

Through the post-program survey and experience papers, REU participants indicate their future plans, which include but are not limited to research in STEM fields, pursuing graduate schools, PhD programs as well as corporate careers. This also serves as a means for us to gauge the level of impact our REU program had on the participants future career choices.
